channel.title: Homes on Balakumar Sundaralingam
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Balakumar Sundaralingam

item.title: Relaxed-Rigidity Constraints
item.description: Performing In-grasp manipulation through purely kinematic trajectory optimization.

Biography I am a PhD candidate at the University of Utah, affilitated to the School of Computing and the Utah Robotics Center. I am advised by Tucker Hermans at the LL4MA lab. I am currently exploring dexterous manipulation of novel objects (Project Page) and how multi-sensory perception (Project Page) can aid manipulation. In summer of 2018, I interned in the Seattle Robotics Lab at NVIDIA Research. I worked with Dieter Fox, Nathan Ratliff, Ankur Handa, Stan Birchfield, and Byron Boots on tactile perception for robotic manipulation.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I was a teaching assistant at University of Utah for the following courses: ME EN 3230: Mechatronics CS 6310: Robotics CS 7320: System Identification for Robotics I created labs with the Baxter robot for CS 6310 and CS 7320. Left: Circle Point Analysis to estimate joint axis of rotation Right: Load inertial estimation using wrist mounted force/torque sensor
